abstract: Police killing of Renato and Jaypee Bertes in Philippines represents brutality of Pres Rodrigo Duterte's war on drugs; men, who lived in squalid conditions in Manila slum and used and occasionally sold cheap form of methamphetamine, were arrested, severely beaten and shot to death in police station; case is expected to be among those highlighted at Senate Committee on Justice and Human Rights hearing.

headline.print_headline: Pair Killed by Police Focus Spotlight on Abuses in Philippine Drug War
headline.main: Chilling Tale in Duterte’s Drug War: Father and Son Killed in Police Custody

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Even amid the slaughter of the Filipino president’s war on drugs, the killings of Renato and Jaypee Bertes stand out....
lead_paragraph: Even amid the slaughter of the Filipino president’s war on drugs, the killings of Renato and Jaypee Bertes stand out.
